result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve C Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steve C Thomas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steve C Thomas was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Forfeiture  of 1,200.00 plus court costs, all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge.  By  first by applying any bail on deposit.  Remaining balance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving the first six (6) months of sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  ABsolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No  alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steve C Thomas in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY in COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 40 days time served.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. after serving the first 6 months of sentence
-Defendant to pay a forfeiture in the amount of $1,200.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by first applying any bail on deposit.  Remaining balance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
-Court authorizes extended supervision transferred to New York
-Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 24 months
-Court ordered ignition interlock for 24 months 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program received and filed.

Defendant Steve C Thomas in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Matter rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM031885  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-01-15

Defendant Steve C Thomas in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense motion for modification of bail heard and granted.  Court modifies bail to $1,700.00 cash TOT WCS SCRAM bracelet.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERS OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF BAIL TO REMAIN THE SAME.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED to $2000.00 CASH.

Defendant Steve C Thomas in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Steve C Thomas in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No driving without a valid license and insurance.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steve C Thomas in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Steve C Thomas in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
